metadata.Title: CVE-2021-4093 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in the KVM's AMD code for supporting the Secure EncryptedVirtualization-Encrypted State (SEV-ES). A KVM guest using SEV-ES cantrigger out-of-bounds reads and writes in the host kernel via a maliciousVMGEXIT for a string I/O instruction (for example, outs or ins) using theexit reason SVM_EXIT_IOIO. This issue results in a crash of the entiresystem or a potential guest-to-host escape scenario.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4093` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic-64k - 5.19.0-21.21
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-kvm - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1009-aws - 5.19.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-azure - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-gcp - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-ibm - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-oracle - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1007-lowlatency - 5.19.0-1007.7
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1007-lowlatency-64k - 5.19.0-1007.7
No subscription required
